channel.title: CVE Feed for unspecified -- jenkins
channel.description: The latest CVEs for unspecified -- jenkins

item.title: CVE-2017-2606|2024-08-05T14:02:06.482Z -- unspecified -- jenkins
item.description: Jenkins before versions 2.44, 2.32.2 is vulnerable to an information exposure in the internal API that allows access to item names that should not be visible (SECURITY-380). This only affects anonymous users (other users legitimately have access) that were able to get a list of items via an UnprotectedRootAction.

item.title: CVE-2017-2601|2024-08-05T14:02:06.982Z -- unspecified -- jenkins
item.description: Jenkins before versions 2.44, 2.32.2 is vulnerable to a persisted cross-site scripting in parameter names and descriptions (SECURITY-353). Users with the permission to configure jobs were able to inject JavaScript into parameter names and descriptions.

item.title: CVE-2017-2611|2024-08-05T14:02:06.500Z -- unspecified -- jenkins
item.description: Jenkins before versions 2.44, 2.32.2 is vulnerable to an insufficient permission check for periodic processes (SECURITY-389). The URLs /workspaceCleanup and /fingerprintCleanup did not perform permission checks, allowing users with read access to Jenkins to trigger these background processes (that are otherwise performed daily), possibly causing additional load on Jenkins master and agents.
